intro: Oxymitra mindorensis, commonly known as the Mindanao oxymitra, is a rare flowering plant native to the Philippines. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers and elliptical leaves. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments within montane forests. It is distinguished by its unique floral structure and limited distribution, making it a subject of interest for botanists. Due to habitat loss, it is considered endangered and requires conservation efforts to ensure its survival.
